intro: Uragoga tenuinervis, commonly known as the slender-veined uragoga, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with finely veined foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, which are often borne on slender peduncles. Its root system is fibrous and has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits. Uragoga tenuinervis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
